file_content.text: Taris deserves at least one beautiful thing. That base will be it, if we get the workers.
Y--you're back. That must mean--the Mandalorians must be gone.
You can restart work on the construction site whenever you like.
Yes, the base is safe.
Not without a fight.
I knew those Mandalorian scum wouldn't trouble someone like you!
If that base is so precious, the site should have guards. I don't want to be troubled with this again.
Next time, get some security.
Why are you yelling at me? I wasn't the foreman. But, you make a good point.
And I'd like compensation.
What? Oh, yes, of course.
Here. I know this isn't much in return. But I'll make sure that new base has something in it named after you.
Remember: Use the power cells to get the elevator running. That'll get you to the upper levels, where the Mandalorians and their droids are.
Please, Master Jedi, do something! They killed everyone, I'm the only one left!
You're a soldier, aren't you? You have to do something! They killed everyone, I'm the only one left!
Please! You've got to help me! They killed everyone, I'm the only one left!
We were working on the Reconstruction Authority's new base. It'll be so beautiful....
But, yesterday, they came from nowhere. Mandalorian mercenaries! Those murderers slaughtered everyone; someone's hired them to destroy the construction site!
Preying on unarmed workers is low, even for mercenaries.
Despicable.
We had tools; we tried to fight back. Didn't do any good. Those Mandalorians know their business.
Mandalorian or not, mercenaries are ruthless. How did you get away from them?
But you escaped.
I... I played dead. I had to listen while they killed my friends, planned to destroy everything we'd made!
So someone gave them orders.
Probably some Imperial. The Reconstruction Authority's "investigating," but what good will that do? The site's in danger right now!
Hiring Mandalorians to destroy a building is like using a blaster to clean your fingernails.
That's overkill.
Someone wants the new base gone, probably some Imperial, and I can see why.
Are you sure?
It's true! They brought demolition droids--why else would Mandalorians care about a building?
It's only a construction site.
That new base symbolizes the reconstruction effort. Reclaiming Taris, making something worthwhile from this chaos.... It has to be saved!
The Mandalorians and their demolition droids are on the upper levels right now, planting bombs and cutting into the superstructure.
I'll do it.
You have to deactivate the Mandalorian bombs to save the building. Our ion dischargers can do that--and you can find them by the generator, if you hurry!
We kept ion dischargers by the generator, in case there was an overload... you could use one to deactivate the Mandalorians' bombs and save the building! Please!
Show that Mando scum that the Republic doesn't give up without a fight!
Sorry, no. [Refuse quest]
But with that base destroyed--forget it. You obviously don't care about Taris, or her future!
They're killers, all of them!
Ion what?
